New Records: LeBron James extended his NBA-record streak of 1,226 games with at least 10 points.
Key Match Events: The Los Angeles Lakers fell to the Phoenix Suns 109-105, marking their first loss of the season after a strong 3-0 start.
Despite leading by 18 points early in the game, the Lakers could not maintain their advantage.
LeBron James scored only 11 points on 3-of-14 shooting.
Anthony Davis and Austin Reaves put up strong performances, scoring 29 and 23 points respectively.
The Suns, led by Devin Booker with 33 points and Kevin Durant with 30, rallied back.

A critical moment came when James, with the Lakers trailing by three, intentionally missed a free throw but failed to secure the rebound, allowing the Suns to seal the win with free throws from Bradley Beal.
Post-Match Reflections: Lakers' head coach JJ Redick took responsibility for not adjusting the defense earlier in the fourth quarter to counter Durant's strategy.
JJ Redick acknowledged that he could have adjusted the defense earlier in the fourth quarter to better handle Durant's strategy, taking responsibility for the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers' strong start to the season (3-1) ties for their best in the LeBron James era, reminiscent of their championship-winning season in 2019-20.
